member.name: T:System.WindowsRuntimeSystemExtensions
member.summary: Provides extension methods for converting between tasks and Windows Runtime asynchronous actions and operations.

member.name: M:System.WindowsRuntimeSystemExtensions.AsAsyncAction(System.Threading.Tasks.Task)
member.summary: Returns a Windows Runtime asynchronous action that represents a started task.
member.returns: A Windows.Foundation.IAsyncAction instance that represents the started task.
member.param: The started task.

member.name: M:System.WindowsRuntimeSystemExtensions.AsAsyncOperation``1(System.Threading.Tasks.Task{``0})
member.summary: Returns a Windows Runtime asynchronous operation that represents a started task that returns a result.
member.returns: A Windows.Foundation.IAsyncOperation<TResult> instance that represents the started task.
member.param: The started task.
member.typeparam: The type that returns the result.

member.name: M:System.WindowsRuntimeSystemExtensions.AsTask(Windows.Foundation.IAsyncAction)
member.summary: Returns a task that represents a Windows Runtime asynchronous action.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous action.
member.param: The asynchronous action.

member.name: M:System.WindowsRuntimeSystemExtensions.AsTask(Windows.Foundation.IAsyncAction,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Returns a task that represents a Windows Runtime asynchronous action that can be cancelled.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous action.
member.param: The asynchronous action.
A token that can be used to request cancellation of the asynchronous action.

member.name: M:System.WindowsRuntimeSystemExtensions.AsTask``1(Windows.Foundation.IAsyncActionWithProgress{``0})
member.summary: Returns a task that represents a Windows Runtime asynchronous action.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous action.
member.param: The asynchronous action.
member.typeparam: The type of object that provides data that indicates progress.

member.name: M:System.WindowsRuntimeSystemExtensions.AsTask``1(Windows.Foundation.IAsyncActionWithProgress{``0},System.IProgress{``0})
member.summary: Returns a task that represents a Windows Runtime asynchronous action that reports progress.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous action.
member.param: The asynchronous action.
An object that receives progress updates.
member.typeparam: The type of object that provides data that indicates progress.

member.name: M:System.WindowsRuntimeSystemExtensions.AsTask``1(Windows.Foundation.IAsyncActionWithProgress{``0},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Returns a task that represents a Windows Runtime asynchronous action that can be cancelled.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous action.
member.param: The asynchronous action.
A token that can be used to request cancellation of the asynchronous action.
member.typeparam: The type of object that provides data that indicates progress.

member.name: M:System.WindowsRuntimeSystemExtensions.AsTask``1(Windows.Foundation.IAsyncActionWithProgress{``0},System.Threading.CancellationToken,System.IProgress{``0})
member.summary: Returns a task that represents a Windows Runtime asynchronous action that reports progress and can be cancelled.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous action.
member.param: The asynchronous action.
A token that can be used to request cancellation of the asynchronous action.
An object that receives progress updates.
member.typeparam: The type of object that provides data that indicates progress.

member.summary: Returns a task that represents a Windows Runtime asynchronous operation returns a result.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation.
member.param: The asynchronous operation.
member.typeparam: The type of object that returns the result of the asynchronous operation.

member.summary: Returns a task that represents a Windows Runtime asynchronous operation that returns a result and can be cancelled.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation.

A token that can be used to request cancellation of the asynchronous operation.
member.typeparam: The type of object that returns the result of the asynchronous operation.

member.name: T:System.IO.WindowsRuntimeStorageExtensions
member.summary: Contains extension methods for the IStorageFile and IStorageFolder interfaces in the Windows Runtime when developing Windows Store apps.

member.name: M:System.IO.WindowsRuntimeStorageExtensions.OpenStreamForReadAsync(Windows.Storage.IStorageFile)
member.summary: Retrieves a stream for reading from a specified file.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous read operation.
member.param: The Windows Runtime IStorageFile object to read from.
member.exception: The file could not be opened or retrieved as a stream.

member.name: M:System.IO.WindowsRuntimeStorageExtensions.OpenStreamForReadAsync(Windows.Storage.IStorageFolder,System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves a stream for reading from a file in the specified parent folder.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous read operation.
member.param: The Windows Runtime IStorageFolder object that contains the file to read from.
The path, relative to the root folder, to the file to read from.
member.exception: is empty or contains only white-space characters.
The file could not be opened or retrieved as a stream.

member.name: M:System.IO.WindowsRuntimeStorageExtensions.OpenStreamForWriteAsync(Windows.Storage.IStorageFile)
member.summary: Retrieves a stream for writing to a specified file.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous write operation.
member.param: The Windows Runtime IStorageFile object to write to.
member.exception: The file could not be opened or retrieved as a stream.

member.name: M:System.IO.WindowsRuntimeStorageExtensions.OpenStreamForWriteAsync(Windows.Storage.IStorageFolder,System.String,Windows.Storage.CreationCollisionOption)
member.summary: Retrieves a stream for writing to a file in the specified parent folder.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous write operation.
member.param: The Windows Runtime IStorageFolder object that contains the file to write to.
The path, relative to the root folder, to the file to write to.
The Windows Runtime CreationCollisionOption enumeration value that specifies the behavior to use when the name of the file to create is the same as the name of an existing file.
member.exception: is empty or contains only white-space characters.
The file could not be opened or retrieved as a stream.

member.name: T:System.IO.WindowsRuntimeStreamExtensions
member.summary: Contains extension methods for converting between streams in the Windows Runtime and managed streams in the .NET for Windows Store apps.

member.name: M:System.IO.WindowsRuntimeStreamExtensions.AsInputStream(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Converts a managed stream in the .NET for Windows Store apps to an input stream in the Windows Runtime.
member.returns: A Windows Runtime IInputStream object that represents the converted stream.
member.param: The stream to convert.
member.exception: The stream does not support reading.

member.name: M:System.IO.WindowsRuntimeStreamExtensions.AsOutputStream(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Converts a managed stream in the .NET for Windows Store apps to an output stream in the Windows Runtime.
member.returns: A Windows Runtime IOutputStream object that represents the converted stream.
member.param: The stream to convert.
member.exception: The stream does not support writing.

member.name: M:System.IO.WindowsRuntimeStreamExtensions.AsRandomAccessStream(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Converts the specified stream to a random access stream.
member.returns: A Windows Runtime RandomAccessStream, which represents the converted stream.
member.param: The stream to convert.

member.name: M:System.IO.WindowsRuntimeStreamExtensions.AsStream(Windows.Storage.Streams.IRandomAccessStream)
member.summary: Converts a random access stream in the Windows Runtime to a managed stream in the .NET for Windows Store apps.
member.returns: The converted stream.
member.param: The Windows Runtime IRandomAccessStream object to convert.

member.name: M:System.IO.WindowsRuntimeStreamExtensions.AsStream(Windows.Storage.Streams.IRandomAccessStream,System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts a random access stream in the Windows Runtime to a managed stream in the .NET for Windows Store apps using the specified buffer size.
member.returns: The converted stream.
member.param: The Windows Runtime IRandomAccessStream object to convert.
The size, in bytes, of the buffer. This value cannot be negative, but it can be 0 (zero) to disable buffering.

member.name: M:System.IO.WindowsRuntimeStreamExtensions.AsStreamForRead(Windows.Storage.Streams.IInputStream)
member.summary: Converts an input stream in the Windows Runtime to a managed stream in the .NET for Windows Store apps.
member.returns: The converted stream.
member.param: The Windows Runtime IInputStream object to convert.

member.name: M:System.IO.WindowsRuntimeStreamExtensions.AsStreamForRead(Windows.Storage.Streams.IInputStream,System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts an input stream in the Windows Runtime to a managed stream in the .NET for Windows Store apps using the specified buffer size.
member.returns: The converted stream.
member.param: The Windows Runtime IInputStream object to convert.
The size, in bytes, of the buffer. This value cannot be negative, but it can be 0 (zero) to disable buffering.

member.name: M:System.IO.WindowsRuntimeStreamExtensions.AsStreamForWrite(Windows.Storage.Streams.IOutputStream)
member.summary: Converts an output stream in the Windows Runtime to a managed stream in the .NET for Windows Store apps.
member.returns: The converted stream.
member.param: The Windows Runtime IOutputStream object to convert.

member.name: M:System.IO.WindowsRuntimeStreamExtensions.AsStreamForWrite(Windows.Storage.Streams.IOutputStream,System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts an output stream in the Windows Runtime to a managed stream in the .NET for Windows Store apps using the specified buffer size.
member.returns: The converted stream.
member.param: The Windows Runtime IOutputStream object to convert.
The size, in bytes, of the buffer. This value cannot be negative, but it can be 0 (zero) to disable buffering.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.InteropServices.WindowsRuntime.AsyncInfo
member.summary: Provides factory methods to construct representations of managed tasks that are compatible with Windows Runtime asynchronous actions and operations.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.InteropServices.WindowsRuntime.AsyncInfo.Run``1(System.Func{System.Threading.CancellationToken,System.Threading.Tasks.Task{``0}})
member.summary: Creates and starts a Windows Runtime asynchronous operation by using a function that generates a started task that returns results. The task can support cancellation.
member.returns: A started Windows.Foundation.IAsyncOperation<TResult> instance that represents the task that is generated by .
member.param: A delegate that represents the function that creates and starts the task. The started task is represented by the Windows Runtime asynchronous operation that is returned. The function is passed a cancellation token that the task can monitor to be notified of cancellation requests; you can ignore the token if your task does not support cancellation.
member.typeparam: The type that returns the result.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.InteropServices.WindowsRuntime.AsyncInfo.Run(System.Func{System.Threading.CancellationToken,System.Threading.Tasks.Task})
member.summary: Creates and starts a Windows Runtime asynchronous action by using a function that generates a started task. The task can support cancellation.
member.returns: A started Windows.Foundation.IAsyncAction instance that represents the task that is generated by .
member.param: A delegate that represents the function that creates and starts the task. The started task is represented by the Windows Runtime asynchronous action that is returned. The function is passed a cancellation token that the task can monitor to be notified of cancellation requests; you can ignore the token if your task does not support cancellation.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.InteropServices.WindowsRuntime.AsyncInfo.Run``2(System.Func{System.Threading.CancellationToken,System.IProgress{``1},System.Threading.Tasks.Task{``0}})
member.summary: Creates and starts a Windows Runtime asynchronous operation that includes progress updates, by using a function that generates a started task that returns results. The task can support cancellation and progress reporting.
member.returns: A started Windows.Foundation.IAsyncOperationWithProgress<TResult,TProgress> instance that represents the task that is generated by .
member.param: A delegate that represents the function that creates and starts the task. The started task is represented by the Windows Runtime asynchronous action that is returned. The function is passed a cancellation token that the task can monitor to be notified of cancellation requests, and an interface for reporting progress; you can ignore either or both of these arguments if your task does not support progress reporting or cancellation.
member.typeparam: The type that returns the result.
The type that is used for progress notifications.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.InteropServices.WindowsRuntime.AsyncInfo.Run``1(System.Func{System.Threading.CancellationToken,System.IProgress{``0},System.Threading.Tasks.Task})
member.summary: Creates and starts a Windows Runtime asynchronous action that includes progress updates, by using a function that generates a started task. The task can support cancellation and progress reporting.
member.returns: A started Windows.Foundation.IAsyncActionWithProgress<TProgress> instance that represents the task that is generated by .
member.param: A delegate that represents the function that creates and starts the task. The started task is represented by the Windows Runtime asynchronous action that is returned. The function is passed a cancellation token that the task can monitor to be notified of cancellation requests, and an interface for reporting progress; you can ignore either or both of these arguments if your task does not support progress reporting or cancellation.
member.typeparam: The type that is used for progress notifications.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.InteropServices.WindowsRuntime.WindowsRuntimeBuffer
member.summary: Provides an implementation of the Windows Runtime IBuffer interface (Windows.Storage.Streams.IBuffer), and all additional required interfaces.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.InteropServices.WindowsRuntime.WindowsRuntimeBuffer.Create(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a Windows.Storage.Streams.IBuffer interface that contains a specified range of bytes copied from a byte array. If the specified capacity is greater than the number of bytes copied, the rest of the buffer is zero-filled.
member.returns: A Windows.Storage.Streams.IBuffer interface that contains the specified range of bytes. If is greater than , the rest of the buffer is zero-filled.
member.param: The byte array to copy from.
The offset in from which copying begins.
The number of bytes to copy.
The maximum number of bytes the buffer can hold; if this is greater than , the rest of the bytes in the buffer are initialized to 0 (zero).
member.exception: Starting at , does not contain elements. -or-Starting at , does not contain elements.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.InteropServices.WindowsRuntime.WindowsRuntimeBuffer.Create(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns an empty Windows.Storage.Streams.IBuffer interface that has the specified maximum capacity.
member.returns: A Windows.Storage.Streams.IBuffer interface that has the specified capacity and a Length property equal to 0 (zero).
member.param: The maximum number of bytes the buffer can hold.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.InteropServices.WindowsRuntime.WindowsRuntimeBufferExtensions
member.summary: Provides extension methods for operating on Windows Runtime buffers (Windows.Storage.Streams.IBuffer interface).

member.name: M:System.Runtime.InteropServices.WindowsRuntime.WindowsRuntimeBufferExtensions.AsBuffer(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Returns a Windows.Storage.Streams.IBuffer interface that represents the specified byte array.
member.returns: A Windows.Storage.Streams.IBuffer interface that represents the specified byte array.
member.param: The array to represent.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.InteropServices.WindowsRuntime.WindowsRuntimeBufferExtensions.AsBuffer(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a Windows.Storage.Streams.IBuffer interface that represents a range of bytes in the specified byte array.
member.returns: An IBuffer interface that represents the specified range of bytes in .
member.param: The array that contains the range of bytes that is represented by the IBuffer.
The offset in where the range begins.
The length of the range that is represented by the IBuffer.
member.exception: The array is not large enough to serve as a backing store for the IBuffer; that is, the number of bytes in , beginning at , is less than .

member.name: M:System.Runtime.InteropServices.WindowsRuntime.WindowsRuntimeBufferExtensions.AsBuffer(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a Windows.Storage.Streams.IBuffer interface that represents a range of bytes in the specified byte array. Optionally sets the Length property of the IBuffer to a value that is less than the capacity.
member.returns: An IBuffer interface that represents the specified range of bytes in and that has the specified Length property value.
member.param: The array that contains the range of bytes that is represented by the IBuffer.
The offset in where the range begins.
The value of the Length property of the IBuffer.
The size of the range that is represented by the IBuffer. The Capacity property of the IBuffer is set to this value.
member.exception: is greater than . -or-The array is not large enough to serve as a backing store for the IBuffer; that is, the number of bytes in , beginning at , is less than or .

member.name: M:System.Runtime.InteropServices.WindowsRuntime.WindowsRuntimeBufferExtensions.AsStream(Windows.Storage.Streams.IBuffer)
member.summary: Returns a stream that represents the same memory that the specified Windows.Storage.Streams.IBuffer interface represents.
member.returns: A stream that represents the same memory that the specified Windows.Storage.Streams.IBuffer interface represents.
member.param: The IBuffer to represent as a stream.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.InteropServices.WindowsRuntime.WindowsRuntimeBufferExtensions.CopyTo(System.Byte[],System.Int32,Windows.Storage.Streams.IBuffer,System.UInt32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Copies bytes from the source array to the destination buffer (Windows.Storage.Streams.IBuffer), specifying the starting index in the source array, the starting index in the destination buffer, and the number of bytes to copy. The method does not update the Length property of the destination buffer.
member.param: The array to copy data from.
The index in to begin copying data from.
The buffer to copy data to.
The index in to begin copying data to.
The number of bytes to copy.
member.exception: is greater than or equal to the length of . -or-The number of bytes in , beginning at , is less than . -or-Copying bytes, beginning at , would exceed the capacity of .

member.summary: Copies all bytes from the source array to the destination buffer (Windows.Storage.Streams.IBuffer), starting at offset 0 (zero) in both. The method does not update the length of the destination buffer.
member.param: The array to copy data from.
The buffer to copy data to.
member.exception: The size of exceeds the capacity of .

member.name: M:System.Runtime.InteropServices.WindowsRuntime.WindowsRuntimeBufferExtensions.GetWindowsRuntimeBuffer(System.IO.MemoryStream)
member.summary: Returns a Windows.Storage.Streams.IBuffer interface that represents the same memory as the specified memory stream.
member.returns: A Windows.Storage.Streams.IBuffer interface that is backed by the same memory that backs the specified memory stream.
member.param: The stream that provides the backing memory for the IBuffer.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.InteropServices.WindowsRuntime.WindowsRuntimeBufferExtensions.GetWindowsRuntimeBuffer(System.IO.MemoryStream,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a Windows.Storage.Streams.IBuffer interface that represents a region within the memory that the specified memory stream represents.
member.returns: A Windows.Storage.Streams.IBuffer interface that is backed by a region within the memory that backs the specified memory stream.
member.param: The stream that shares memory with the IBuffer.
The position of the shared memory region in .
The maximum size of the shared memory region. If the number of bytes in , starting at , is less than , the IBuffer that is returned represents only the available bytes.
member.exception: cannot expose its underlying memory buffer.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.InteropServices.WindowsRuntime.WindowsRuntimeBufferExtensions.IsSameData(Windows.Storage.Streams.IBuffer,Windows.Storage.Streams.IBuffer)
member.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether two buffers (Windows.Storage.Streams.IBuffer objects) represent the same underlying memory region.
member.returns: true if the memory regions that are represented by the two buffers have the same starting point; otherwise, false.
member.param: The first buffer.
The second buffer.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.InteropServices.WindowsRuntime.WindowsRuntimeBufferExtensions.ToArray(Windows.Storage.Streams.IBuffer)
member.summary: Returns a new array that is created from the contents of the specified buffer (Windows.Storage.Streams.IBuffer). The size of the array is the value of the Length property of the IBuffer.
member.returns: A byte array that contains the bytes in the specified IBuffer, beginning at offset 0 (zero) and including a number of bytes equal to the value of the Length property of the IBuffer.
member.param: The buffer whose contents populate the new array.

member.returns: A byte array that contains the specified range of bytes.
member.param: The buffer whose contents populate the new array.
The index in to begin copying data from.
The number of bytes to copy.
member.exception: is greater than or equal to the capacity of . -or-The number of bytes in , beginning at , is less than .
